GET /api.description: serves up a json representation of all the available endpoints of the api

GET /api/projects.description: serves up an array of all projects
queries: Accepts all properties of a project as a query, e.g: '/api/projects?ClientName=Network Rail Limited'.  Multiple project queries can be included; they are matched with AND, not OR.
Keywords can be queried using 'Keyword=AP00054'
Multiple Keywords can be queried using 'Keyword=AP00054;AP00099
By default, keywords will be matched using 'AND' logic (i.e. all keywords must match for the project to be returned.
To match keywords using 'OR' logic, chain the additional query: '&KeywordQueryType=OR'

Keyword queries can be combined with project queries; this will use 'AND' logic (i.e. all project filters must be met, AND the relevant keyword logic).  The keyword logic WILL - respect the KeywordQueryType 'OR' operator.
Accepts queries on project dates: EndDateAfter=2020-01-01; EndDateBefore=2021-01-01; StartDateAfter=2018-01-01;
includeConfidential=true will mean that results include confidential projects - otherwise these are excluded

projects.ScopeOfService: Full structural, mechanical, electrical and public health engineering design services up to RIBA Stage E with client side role during the construction works. Extensive list of specialist services to be provided, including access consultancy.
ScopeOfWorks:
The Londoner hotel.

Development of a 350 bed hotel which will contain the deepest habitable-grade commercial building basement in London, on the Odeon site in Leicester Square, London. It features six levels built underground to a depth of 30m. Situated within a constrained site measuring less than 50m by 50m, 65,000mÂ³ of clay has been excavated prior to construction, enough to fill 26 Olympic-sized swimming pools. The basement will house leisure and banqueting facilities including a two-screen cinema, with a further nine levels above ground.

projects.ScopeOfService:
Engineering design including civil, structural, geotechnical, fire, facade engineering, plus acoustics, specialist lighting and sustainability consultancy. 

Our design for Copenhagen Arena was developed through Feasibility, Concept, Scheme and Detailed Design, providing a full set of Tender and then Construction information and as-built records. This documentation included drawings, reports and detailed specifications. All of the documentation was developed specifically to reflect the requirements of the supply chain, the third party checking team and the approving authorities. This facilitated smooth delivery and approval.
ScopeOfWorks: Arena for concerts and sport, with a seated capacity of 12,500 people and a maximum capacity of 15,000. Situated in Orestad, between Copenhagen City Centre and Kastrup Airport.

POST /api/projects/staff.description: when passed a list of projects, returns a list of staff who have worked on those projects
queries: accepts all properties of staffMeta as queries, e.g 'GradeLevel=5'.  Multiple queries can be included; they are matched with AND, not OR.

GET /api/projects/staff.description: serves up an array of staff, including relevant experience, who meet the filters
queries: Accepts all properties of a project as a query, e.g: '/api/projects?ClientName=Network Rail Limited'.  Multiple project queries can be included; they are matched with AND, not OR.
Also accepts the following staff queries: StaffName, LocationName, JobTitle, GradeLevel,DisciplineName.  These can be combined with other queries.
Keywords can be queried using 'Keyword=AP00054'
Multiple Keywords can be queried using 'Keyword=AP00054;AP00099
By default, keywords will be matched using 'AND' logic (i.e. all keywords must match for the project to be returned.
To match keywords using 'OR' logic, chain the additional query: '&KeywordQueryType=OR'

Keyword queries can be combined with project queries; this will use 'AND' logic (i.e. all project filters must be met, AND the relevant keyword logic).  The keyword logic WILL - respect the KeywordQueryType 'OR' operator.
Accepts queries on project dates: EndDateAfter=2020-01-01; EndDateBefore=2021-01-01; StartDateAfter=2018-01-01;
includeConfidential=true will mean that results include confidential projects - otherwise these are excluded

GET /api/projects/staff/:StaffID.description: serves up project list for an individual
queries: showDetails=true will mean project details are included
OR accepts all properties of a project as queries, e.g 'ClientName=Muse Developments Ltd'.  Multiple queries can be included; they are matched with AND, not OR.
Keywords can be queried using 'Keyword=AP00054'
Multiple Keywords can be queried using 'Keyword=AP00054;AP00099
By default, keywords will be matched using 'AND' logic (i.e. all keywords must match for the project to be returned.
To match keywords using 'OR' logic, chain the additional query: '&KeywordQueryType=OR'

Keyword queries can be combined with project queries; this will use 'AND' logic (i.e. all project filters must be met, AND the relevant keyword logic).  The keyword logic WILL - respect the KeywordQueryType 'OR' operator.
Accepts queries on project dates: EndDateAfter=2020-01-01; EndDateBefore=2021-01-01; StartDateAfter=2018-01-01;
includeConfidential=true will mean that results include confidential projects - otherwise these are excluded

GET /api/projects/keywords/:StaffID.description: serves up an array of keywords that a staff member has worked on
queries: accepts all properties of a project as queries, e.g 'ClientName=Muse Developments Ltd'.  Multiple queries can be included; they are matched with AND, not OR.

GET /api/staff/meta.description: fetch meta data for all staff; can be filtered by any staff meta key
queries: GradeLevel=6
accepts any staff meta key(s)

GET /api/staff/meta/:StaffID.description: fetch meta data for an individual

PATCH /api/staff/meta/:StaffID.description: updates staff metadata for an individual.  Array values can be updated by sending the entire array as part of the patch object - see example below.

examplePatchObject.highLevelDescription: Sam operates at a VERY high level

staffMeta.highLevelDescription: Sam operates at a VERY high level

POST /api/staff/meta/:StaffID.description: updates staff photo for an individual
POST /api/staff/meta/:StaffID.examplePostObject: image file within a data form

staffMeta.highLevelDescription: Sam operates at a VERY high level

GET /api/project/:ProjectCode.description: get project details by project code
queries: StaffID=37704 also includes a staff member's experience and time on the project

project.ScopeOfService: Multi-disciplinary appointment, initially in support of bid, then project delivery if Muse are successful.
ScopeOfWorks: Mixed use development in central Warrington, for the Bridge Street Quarter.

GET /api/project/keywords/:ProjectCode.description: get keyword codes for a project, including the related keywords from the keyword thesaurus

PATCH /api/project/:ProjectCode.description: amend project details. ScopeOfWorks can be updated by sending the entire array as part of the patch object - see example below.  For imgURL, use POST or DELETE.  Keywords cannot be patched, these need to be changed on the Arup system

ScopeOfWorks: Mixed use development in central Warrington, for the Bridge Street Quarter.
Mixed use development in central Warrington, for the Bridge Street Quarter.

POST /api/project/:ProjectCode.description: updates a photo for a project
POST /api/project/:ProjectCode.examplePostObject: image file within a data form

ScopeOfWorks: Mixed use development in central Warrington, for the Bridge Street Quarter.

DELETE /api/project/:ProjectCode.description: deletes a photo for a project

ScopeOfWorks: Mixed use development in central Warrington, for the Bridge Street Quarter.

examplePatchObject.experience: Sam worked really hard on this project.

project.ScopeOfService: Multi-disciplinary appointment, initially in support of bid, then project delivery if Muse are successful.
project.ScopeOfWorks: Mixed use development in central Warrington, for the Bridge Street Quarter.
project.experience: Sam worked really hard on this project.

POST /api/project/staff/:ProjectCode.description: add staff experience to project where their time hasn't come from the Arup system
queries: StaffID=37704

examplePatchObject.experience: Sam worked really hard on this project.

experience.experience: Sam worked really hard on this project.

GET /api/keywords.description: serves up an array of all keywords
queries: KeywordGroupCode=AE

GET /api/keywords/groups.description: serves up an array of keyword groups

GET /api/keywords/groups/:StaffID.description: serves up an object containing all keywords that a staff member has worked on, sorted into groups.  The projects that the keywords come from can be queried.
queries: Accepts all properties of a project as a query, e.g: '/api/projects?ClientName=Network Rail Limited'.  Multiple queries can be included; they are matched with AND, not OR.

Keywords: LAT & LONG UPDATE FROM ARUP PROJECTS
